page.title: 05EMPLOYMENT
page.content: People who choose to work in Sidlesham can usually find work on the farms or the smallholdings. The smallholdings are usually owned by husband and wife who both work there.They employ approximately two full time workers,two part time workers and up to fifteen casual workers when the crops are harvested. Crops are sent to the packing sheds which employ about forty people each. Nurseries also provide employment. The largest is Duncan and Davis who employ over twenty people.Twelve farms employ up to ten full time workers each.The three shops have five employees between them and the two public houses have work for up to ten people. In Jury Lane there are four small businesses which employ about twenty people between them.
